JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Applications are invited for a PhD fellowship/scholarship at Graduate School of Technical Sciences, Aarhus University, Denmark, within the Biological and Chemical Engineering programme. The position is available from 01 September 2022 or later.

Research area and project description:
Organic acids are natural preservatives from plants that inhibit spoiling microbes. On the same time, organic acids are also produced by microbes during fermentation. Many structurally different organic acids exist, but it is still not completely clear why and how these organic acids play a role in the interaction of microbes, e.g. organic acids act as antimicrobials but are also used as cross-feeding metabolites.

BIOFUNC will investigate the structure-function relationship of organic acids using high-throughput screening methods using microbes from different environmental systems. Next, BIOFUNC will investigate and compare the specific role of mode of selected organic acids in microbial interactions. Our results will provide fundamental understanding on the mechanisms related to a structurally and compositionally diverse group of natural compounds.
Project description: For technical reasons, you must upload a project description. Please simply copy the project description above, and upload it as a PDF in the application.

Qualifications and specific competences:
Applicants to the PhD position must have a relevant Master’s degree in food or environmental microbiology, microbial ecology, molecular biology, food biotechnology or equivalent program.

Place of employment and place of work:
The place of employment is Aarhus University, and the place of work is Industrial Biotechnology, Functional Microbe Technology Group, Gustav Wieds Vej 10, 8000 Aarhus C

Contacts:
Applicants seeking further information are invited to contact:
  • Associate professor Clarissa Schwab, schwab@bce.au.dk
How to apply:
Please follow this link to submit your application. Application deadline is 10 May 2022 at 23:59 CEST. Preferred starting date is 01 September 2022
For information about application requirements and mandatory attachments, please see our application guide.
Please note:
  • The programme committee may request further information or invite the applicant to attend an interview.
  • Shortlisting will be used, which means that the evaluation committee only will evaluate the most relevant applications.

Aarhus University’s ambition is to be an attractive and inspiring workplace for all and to foster a culture in which each individual has opportunities to thrive, achieve and develop. We view equality and diversity as assets, and we welcome all applicants. All interested candidates are encouraged to apply, regardless of their personal background. Salary and terms of employment are in accordance with applicable collective agreement.
